intro: Senecio pratensis var. delfini, commonly known as the Delfini Senecio, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils and full to partial sunlight. Its bright yellow to orange flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
